result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Paul Edward Chatfield III

records.addlTxt:
Activity: Bail/bond hearing
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

11:38 AM Defendant Paul Edward Chatfield III appeared by phone.  Attorney Robert C Howard Iii appeared by video for Paul Edward Chatfield III.  Prosecuting attorney Margaret Nan Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant to sign bond at the courthouse by November 3, 2022. Remand to branch 7 for scheduling. Bond to continue.
Bail/bond hearing on October 25, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Status conference on June 23, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Activity:  Status conference  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

03:03 PM Defendant Paul Edward Chatfield in court by phone.  David Zarwell appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Not guilty plea already entered.  Defendant trying to get an attorney.  Defendant must sign bond june 1, 2022 between 12 pm and 1 pm.
Status conference on May 25, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Cannot operate a motor vehicle during pendency of case without valid drivers license and insurance.  No contact directly or indirectly with victim C.L.R., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere.

Activity: Initial appearance 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

2:27 PM Defendant Paul Edward Chatfield in court by audio.  Kyle Edward Johnson appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant address and date of birth verified.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.  Signature bond set of $1000 with conditions.  Cannot operate a motor vehicle during pendency of case without valid drivers license and insurance.  No contact directly or indirectly with victim C.L.R., his/her residence, place of employment, vehicle, or elsewhere. Defendant must sign bond on May 10, 2022 between 12 PM and 1 PM.  Defendant stands mute, not guilty plea entered by Court.  Status conference scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Initial appearance on May 9, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
